textList.name: START_BEACON_ZOLTAN
textList.text: You've entered Sophon territory. They have not yet recognized the Pilgrims as an independent nation, but they've cast a blind eye towards the resistance in the past.
The Sophon patrol their borders but let you pass when you ID as Pilgrim. Let's hope they won't be so courteous to the United Empire.
You arrive in Sophon space. From what you have heard they remain politically neutral, unwilling to risk alienating the Pilgrims or the powerful United Empire.
You're far from Pilgrim home space here in Sophon territory, and it's not clear whether the authorities will have any goodwill remaining. Still, you have to push forward.

textList.name: STORE_ZOLTAN
textList.text: The Sophon are fascinated by other species, and have set up something of an alien knick-knack shop here. Why not take a look?
An IHTG trade ship hails: "My friends! Please, there is nothing I don't have, and there is nothing worth wanting that I can't get. Why not take a look around my shop?"
A Mantis crew here has hunkered down in the abdomen of a long-dead space-whale - the only way, presumably, for them to operate their black-market trade without detection. Worth a look?

textList.name: NOTHING_ZOLTAN
textList.text: There are some mineral-rich asteroids here that the Sophon have left idle, but you've none of the necessary equipment to mine them.
You have to admit - Sophon space is a beautiful and peaceful place indeed. However, re-engaging the FTL and finishing your mission is your priority, not sight-seeing.
A light asteroid field is entering the atmosphere of a nearby planet - a fireworks show on a galactic scale. There's little for it but to take in the ambiance and program the next jump.
You stumble upon some Sophon military vessels engaging in combat training. Their Energy Shields are impressive, but you note how quickly beam and ion weaponry take them down.
You don't have time to hail the Sophon ship that was waiting at this beacon before it jumps away. They are an aloof race.
A Sophon orbital research park is stationed at this beacon. You admire the beautiful architecture of the station, but its massive power signature makes you nervous. Time to move on.
A message broadcast from a nearby planet announces the presence of an ancient Sophon university available for visiting. Likely just a tourist trap, but still too bad you don't have the time to visit.

event.name: ZOLTAN_DISTRESS_MANTIS
event.text: Your jump interrupts a Sophon security ship as it follows a Mantis pirate into an asteroid field. They message you, "Your presence here will continue to be tolerated - but please, do not interfere."

choice.text: Interfere and save the Mantis ship.

event.text: Sometimes you have to bet on the underdog - even on the rare occasions that the underdog is a Mantis warship. You set off for the heart of the asteroid field and engage the Sophon there.

choice.text: Interfere and help the Sophon ship.

event.text: You overtake the Sophon and catch up with the Mantis ship in the asteroid belt. Time to make some friends.
The Sophon have their own agenda - best to leave them to it. You prepare to jump.

event.name: ZOLTAN_DISTRESS_SHELL
event.text: You arrive to find a massive Sophon freighter with no one at the helm. It's a mystery what happened to the crew, but it'd be a shame to let the opportunity go to waste.

event.name: ZOLTAN_TRADE_HUB
event.text: You come to a Sophon trade and supply hub - everything the weary traveller needs, provided they have the right documentation.

choice.text: Try to talk your way in.
(Teleporter) Beam directly to the civilian deck.

event.text: You re-materialise in a dark corner of the main concourse and are able to conduct your investigations in peace.

choice.text: (Sophon) Have your crewmember present his official documentation and pay the entry fee [ Dust: -10 ].

event.text: They scan ID that declares your crewmember an official citizen, collect their fee, and let you pass.
You don't have the papers - well, the neuro-laced identity bracelets - to get in, so best not to try.
They don't see many of your species in these parts, and you stick out like a Casvagarian Sea Slug in a Plutonian Shrimp Stew. You make it back to the ship with a gang of Sophon guards in tow!
You pose as traders and succeed in bypassing airlock security - however, it's only a matter of time before someone realizes your ID cards are counterfeit!
You head into a ship supply store. It is a well-equipped, self-service affair. An order is dialled into a terminal, Dust is deposited, and the item is dispatched from a nearby chute.
You head into the cantina for gossip. Topics of conversation in the cantina range from crop distribution microbes to the joys of Slug pleasure cruises.
You overhear one group discussing a newly discovered planet yet to have first contact, and note down its location.

event.name: ZOLTAN_QUEST_PRIMITIVES
event.text: You arrive at the primitive planet that you heard about at the cantina and are surprised to see a Sophon ship facing off against a United Empire warship.

You tap into their frequency and hear the UE captain yelling, "Your ethical integrity be damned, I have orders to establish diplomatic relations with these...these, uh..." You figure you have a few seconds to think while the captain looks up their name.

choice.text: Interfere - make first contact with the primitive aliens.

event.text: The local people - furry, one-eyed tree lizard things - begin chanting when they see you. Suddenly the sky is lit by laser fire - the Sophon opened fire on your ship! You dash back to the shuttle and join the fight.

choice.text: Protect the aliens' way of life - Attack the United Empire ship.

event.text: These creatures should be left to develop at their own pace. You direct all weapons on the United Empire ship and begin the firing sequence.
You don't want to alert the United Empire of your presence and you don't want to anger the Sophon in their territory. The best solution is to leave.

event.name: ZOLTAN_FREE_AUGMENT
event.text: A Sophon academy sits docked just outside the beacon perimeter. They're happy to show you the fruits of their labor, and offer something to take home with you.

event.name: ZOLTAN_FREE_MAP
event.text: The Sophon stationed near this beacon are happy to receive you. As they give you the formal tour of their ship you spy some local star charts and mentally log the details.

event.name: ZOLTAN_ODD_MOON
event.text: Something strikes you as odd about a moon in the distance.
You try not to fixate on the moon in the aft scanner and you set the coordinates for the next jump.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Send a drone to probe the surface.

event.text: Initial scans indicate a network of caves not far underground. You launch a boarding drone and it breaks through the surface into the cavern below.

Your drone discovers a vast cave network and evidence of excavation. Buried deep below you find a Sophon scientist, still hard at work. He tells you that all his colleagues are long dead. You decide not to ask questions and offer to let him join your crew.
A closer inspection reveals signs of habitation on the surface, but nothing else particularly interesting.
Sending a shuttle to explore a beckoning cave system you discover signs of a battle - and a still-functioning weapon!
A deep scan of the surface reveals a cave system that runs for miles, and what looks like a Dust reservoir left over from some heavy-duty construction.
It looks as if a team could break through the fragile layer of the moon's surface into a hidden cavern.
event.choice: Attempt to detonate some explosives to break through the surface. [ Missiles: -1 ].

choice.text: You call this archeology? This is a job for a team of experts, not a warship. Let's get out of here.

event.text: A portion of the surface layer is destroyed in an impressive display, revealing miles of caves. You don't have time to fully explore them, but you find some remains of an old subterranean base that could be useful.
The explosives are set remotely, but the detonation achieves nothing. What a waste.

Your explosives reveal the 'cave' is actually a secret base, located in a network of bunkers just under the surface. Everyone inside is dead; some Mantis clearly came through here recently. It looks like the Sophon were researching advanced ship weaponry. You take one of their better examples back to your ship.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_FIGHT
textList.text: A Sophon ship makes contact. "The nature of the day is rotational. The fever is emaciated. The reason is-" They've caught some nasty deep space dementia. Before you can consider finding help for them, they open fire.
You're surprised when a stationary Sophon ship opens fire. It appears there are aggressive pugilists even among the 'enlightened'.
You receive a message, "This area is off limits. Submit your ship to processing." It's only one guard ship in a lonely beacon. You decide to fight your way out.

You discover a number of Sophon civilian ships fighting off pirates. Unfortunately one ship mistakes your purpose and moves in to attack! They are refusing all communication; you have no choice but to fight.
Like many areas in Sophon space, the residents of this sector prepared well for Galactic war. The military here seem to have given up reasoning with foreigners, preferring instead to attack on sight!

A Sophon ship is waiting at this beacon. They request your identification, but radiation from the sun in this system is disrupting your communications. They take your silence for aggression and move in to attack.
The Sophon ship patrolling this area hails you: "This area is off limits. Secrecy is vital." They power their weapons.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_PIRATE
textList.text: "Emergency, all ships in range, we are under attack!" The frequency matches a nearby Sophon ship; you move in on their pursuer. They take your intervention as a cue to jump away. Cowards.
You jump just in time to witness a Sophon ship's FTL drive overload. In his final moments their captain implores you not to get involved, but it's too late - their attacker is already upon you!
Despite their precautions, pirates have begun to harass the local Sophon settlements across this sector. One such pirate spots your ship and moves in to attack.
A ship with pirate markings demands your surrender. It is sad times when even Sophon space is beset by pirates. You doubt these fools will be missed.
You spot a pirate ship looting a small Sophon cruiser. They spot you and move in to attack before your FTL drive has a chance to recharge.
"Emergency, all ships in range, we are under attack!" The frequency matches a nearby Sophon ship; you move in on their pursuer. They take your intervention as a cue to jump away. Cowards.
You jump just in time to witness a Sophon ship's FTL drive overload. In their final moments they implore you not to get involved, but it's too late - their attacker is already upon you!
Despite their precautions, pirates have begun to harass the local Sophon settlements across this sector. One such pirate spots your ship and moves in to attack.
A ship with pirate markings demand that you surrender. It is sad times when even Sophon space is beset by pirates. You doubt these fools will be missed.
You spot a pirate ship looting a small Sophon cruiser. They spot you and move in to attack before your FTL drive has a chance to recharge.

event.name: ZOLTAN_MANTIS
event.text: You pick up the last broadcast from a rupturing Sophon freighter. A calm voice states: "Mantis attack highly effective; 87% chance of terminal reactor-" You're interrupted by fire off the port bow!

event.name: ZOLTAN_ENGI
event.text: You jump into a debris field that used to be a Sophon cruiser. Unfortunately, its Engi escort takes you for the attacker and retaliates! They refuse all hails.

event.name: ZOLTAN_ASTEROID
event.text: You arrive in an asteroid field and are greeted by a Sophon guard, "By attempting to access these closed mining fields, you are in violation of the Natural Mineral Protection Act. Your weaponry will be confiscated for processing." You don't have time for this.

event.name: ZOLTAN_LIFERAFT
event.text: You pick up a Sophon life raft floating in space. Its inhabitant asks you to retake his ship from the pirates who recently commandeered it. "It is, of course, critical," she concludes, "that you not destroy my vessel in the process."
You refuse to get his ship back, but still offer to drop her off at the next station. The Sophon is displeased, but directs you to a nearby starbase just the same.
She responds haughtily, "Friend, I'm a doctor, not a resistance fighter. I'm not cut out for this space hero business."
She thinks for a moment before looking you in the eye. "Any opportunity to..." she smiles, "...perform research on such a remarkable Human specimen." Is she coming on to you?

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCIENCE_DOCK
event.text: What appears to be a Sophon science ship requests permission to dock.
They leave without a word.
You allow them to approach, but are caught unaware when they open fire!
"We have been studying your little secession movement, and determined that the "Pilgrims" have potential to be a net positive for the galaxy. Please accept this gift to aid your journey.

event.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_FIGHT
event.text: You come to a quiet part of Sophon space and encounter an ancient Sophon wise man who has managed to harness the power of a spatial rift, but seems to have been driven completely mad by the power. "Choose your doom," he demands. This is all part of a day's work.
"You like a challenge. So be it!" A wormhole forms and a confused, angry Mantis ship hurtles toward you!
"Do not be fooled, Pilgrim, by a soft underbelly." You detect a wormhole opening up, and seconds later a Slug ship is attacking from the other direction!
"An ancient foe for a hardened veteran." You detect a wormhole opening up, and a Sower ship appears with guns blazing. It appears they were in combat when they were thrust across space-time.

event.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_SUCCESS
event.text: When he sees you have emerged victorious, the Sophon wise man enters a rage. Rifts threaten to tear space apart until, instead, the Sophon implodes, sending a blast wave of Dust and debris dragged here from distant worlds in your direction.

event.name: ZOLTAN_CREW_SCAN
event.text: You arrive at a Sophon security checkpoint set up in a perimeter around the beacon. "Travelling vessel, you will submit to crew profiling to identify fugitives of the empire."

choice.text: You don't have time for this nonsense. Attack!

event.text: Expecting resistance, their Energy Shield is raised and ready for combat.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug talk them into letting you go.

event.text: You give the guards permission to dock with the ship, but before they come on board your crew member slowly advances to meet them. As far as you can tell no words were exchanged, but the guards offer you some supplies and say the ship checks out. Best to not ask questions.
The Sophon security staff board your ship and scan the crew's faces into a computer. After a few tense moments of uncertainty they allow your ship to pass.

The Sophon security staff board your ship and begin scanning the crew's faces into a computer. Suddenly alarms go off and the Sophon leap on one of your crew! "This person is wanted on five charges of Utter Villainy! Surrender them to us!"
It's a tough call, but Sophon law holds sway here. Besides, that one always seemed a bit shifty.
You're not going to leave anyone behind. You pull away from the station with the enemy guards on board. Unfortunately, they are able to sabotage your weapon system in the chaos. It's time to leave!

event.name: NEBULA_ZOLTAN_ROCK
event.text: At the center of this nebula, a small Sower vessel is mining materials from a metallic asteroid. It seems to identify you as hostile, and opens fire!

event.name: NEBULA_ZOLTAN_EYE
event.text: Inside this nebula you detect a rogue planet drifting through space, on its surface a huge monolith visible at this distance even to the naked eye. A Sophon elder hails you from the planet. "Through luck or intent, you have discovered the Great Eye. Look into its depths and receive your just desert."
Your mission is to save the resistance, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!
You approach the planet and wait, but nothing happens. The Sophon hail: "And in the coming times, when the monolith speaks not with a man he has no future and must be left wanting."

You approach the planet carefully, trying to keep your ship from breaking up in orbit. The monolith, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know you have enough Dust to patch up your damage and more besides!

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colours fills the view-screen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

event.name: STORM_ZOLTAN_SUPPLY_CHOICE
event.text: You spy two pirate ships lurking in the nebula here. They remain unaware of your presence; you're able get your scanners to at least identify their cargo: One is carrying the fuel supplies, the other the ammunition. They begin to drift away from each other in the storm.
You jet toward the pirate with the fuel supplies and engage - hopefully you can leave the ship in one piece!
You jet toward the pirate with the ammunition and engage - hopefully you can leave the ship in one piece!
Sometimes discretion is the better part of valour.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOARDERS
event.text: There are few more zealous in their customs checks than the Sophon. A team of border police beam on board. There's just a little confusion over your weapons licences, but things escalate rapidly from heated discussion to gunfire!

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOARDERS_MANTIS
event.text: The Mantis outcasts sometimes make the mistake of taking the Sophon for easy game. A scout moves in to attack while a boarding party beams aboard from a nearby transport!

event.name: ZOLTAN_PEACE_QUEST
event.text: An unarmed Sophon transport vessel is slowly making its way toward the beacon here. They hail: "This is a Sophon peace envoy. We carry no weapons or shielding and rely on the mercy of others to communicate our message."
They continue. "We take your silence for interested contemplation." They talk at length about quantum uncertainty and fate, but either it's beyond your simple mind or it's all nonsense.
They finish: "Please, spread the word of enlightenment to those that have not heard. Once you have, contact our brethren." They transmit coordinates of their so-called "brethren".
The galaxy is at war - there's no time for talk of peace. You leave their hails unanswered and charge the jump drive.
You charge your weapons - not that this will take much.
Just as you're preparing to attack you detect a nearby jump signature. A Sophon defense ship comes to their aid!

event.name: ZOLTAN_PEACE_QUEST2
event.text: You arrive at the location specified by the peace-loving Sophon, but the only thing nearby is a United Empire ship, closing in fast! "We've found you! You're not getting away this time!"
You power your weapons and prepare to fight.
They open communications: "I can't imagine there's anything you could say that will save you. You bastards should never have betrayed humanity."

choice.text: "Is it too much to ask to allow us to govern ourselves in peace?"

event.text: "Secession is treason. You think this could end any way but war?"

choice.text: The galaxy is huge, you can build your Empire elsewhere and leave us to ourselves.

event.text: "No! We will not allow you to shatter the United Empire just for the sake of your little cult!" They charge.

choice.text: True progress can only be achieved when we are willing to accept that which is not ourselves.

event.text: Suddenly all indications of the loyalist ship fade away and a Sophon fleet appears around your ship. The captain of the ship you met previously materializes on your bridge.

"Although your methods are crude and most certainly ineffective, it is clear you took our previous meeting to heart. If your actions are indicative of Pilgrim ideals, we shall do what we can to aid in their fight."
event.unlockShip: A Zoltan cruiser has been unlocked and added to the hangar!

choice.text: "Surrender. Your ultimate destruction is inevitable. We've left scores of loyalists destroyed in our wake."

event.text: They shut off communications and immediately engage.

choice.text: "Your damned jingoism is causing millions of deaths! The United Empire is an evil one, and Human nationalism is the root of evil in the modern galaxy!"

event.text: "Spreading humanity throughout the stars is our manifest destiny. You have forgotten who you are - I, for one, am still proud to be human!" They charge.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_SURRENDER
textList.text: "Yes, yes, you've demonstrated your species' capacity for violence quite extensively, well done. If we reward your efforts will you bother someone else?"
The enemy ship hails; the vidscreen shows their bridge showered in sparks from malfunctioning equipment - it's safe to assume they're trying to surrender. Accept their offer?

Communications report that the Sophon are broadcasting on all frequencies. The captain appears on screen and says, "Yes, I am not surprised, your species hardly looks enlightened. Fine. Take what you wish."
The Sophon captain hails and mutters something about the border patrol force catching up with you someday; you're more interested in his offer of surrender.
"We assumed that your species intelligence was directly proportional to your brute strength. We yield."
"You have bested us. If only your species' efforts were put to use improving the galaxy rather than your military might."
"Yes, yes, you've demonstrated your species' capacity for violence quite extensively, well done. If we reward your efforts will you bother someone else?"
The enemy's power signature suddenly ceases, save for a weak, repeating signal - it's safe to assume they're trying to surrender. Accept their offer?

Communications report that the Sophon are broadcasting on all frequencies. The captain appears on screen and says, "In the face of superior force, acquiescence is only...logical. Take what you require."
The Sophon captain hails and mutters something about the border patrol force catching up with you someday; you're more interested in his offer of surrender.
"We assumed that your species intelligence was directly proportional to your brute strength. We yield."
"You have bested us. If only your species' efforts were put to use improving the galaxy rather than your military might."
